New Records: Georgia booked a place in the last 16 of Euro 2024 in their debut appearance at a major tournament with a 2-0 win over Portugal.
Georgia's win over Portugal is the biggest upset by FIFA rankings in European Championship history.
Cristiano Ronaldo failed to score in the group stage of a major international tournament for the first time in his career.
Key Match Events: Khvicha Kvaratskhelia scored an early goal in the second minute.
Georges Mikautadze scored a penalty in the 57th minute.
Georgia goalkeeper Giorgi Mamardashvili made late saves to keep Portugal at bay.
Cristiano Ronaldo was booked in the first half for arguing and was substituted after the break.
Pre-Game Insights: Portugal had already qualified for the next round before the match against Georgia.
Post-Match Reflections: Willy Sagnol expressed pride in his team's performance, stating, 'Today I don't have a lot of words. I feel very proud to be their manager.'
Khvicha Kvaratskhelia stated, 'We can fight against everyone. I'm so proud.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Georgia's win means that England will line up against Slovakia, Romania will take on Netherlands, and Portugal will face Slovenia in the round of 16.
The match took place at VELTINS-Arena in Gelsenkirchen, Germany, with an attendance of 49,616.
